Can we determine the original starting phase of \\( z(0) \\) after observing the Fourier transform of \\( z(t) \\) at a later time \\( T \\)?
Explanation: The Fourier transform of \\( z(t) = e^{i\\omega t} \\) will provide information about the frequency \\( \\omega \\) but loses information about the initial phase. Since the spectrum only contains frequency information, the original phase at \\( t = 0 \\) cannot be uniquely determined.
